livedoc feature.description: Adds a feature definition. Features are used to provide the context for the scenarios. Its also a great place to provide summary documentation.

livedoc background.description: Adds a background definition. Backgrounds are used to provide common setup that is not specific to any particular scenario. Use the description to provide details on what the background is doing.

livedoc scenario.description: Adds a scenario definition. Scenarios are used to describe an action by a user or system. When possible make your scenarios focus on the what rather than the how.

livedoc scenario outline.description: Adds a scenario outline definition. Scenario Outlines are used to run multiple sets of data against the same scenario. Each row of the table will form an individual test. When possible make your Scenario Outlines focus on the what rather than the how.

livedoc given.description: Adds a given step definition. Given steps are used to define the current state of the system. Providing a clear description of the setup will make your tests easier to understand.

livedoc when.description: Adds a when step definition. When steps are used to define the action a user or the system takes. Providing a clear description of the action will make your tests easier to understand.

livedoc then.description: Adds a then step definition. Then steps are used to validate the new state of the system. Its best to validate one small part per then, and or but.

livedoc and.description: Adds a and step definition. And steps are used to extend and existing given, when or then. They are used to make test easier to read and understand.

livedoc but.description: Adds a but step definition. But steps are used to extend and existing given, when or then as a negative condition. They are used to make test easier to read and understand.

livedoc step.description: Adds a step definition. Steps are used to describe the scenario. Providing a clear description of each step will make your tests easier to understand.

livedoc step with datatable.description: Adds a step definition with a 2 column data table. Steps are used to describe the scenario. Providing a clear description of each step will make your tests easier to understand.

livedoc step with datatable 4x.description: Adds a step definition with a 4 column data table. Steps are used to describe the scenario. Providing a clear description of each step will make your tests easier to understand.

livedoc step with docString.description: Adds a step definition with a 2 column data table. Steps are used to describe the scenario. Providing a clear description of each step will make your tests easier to understand.

livedoc datatable 4x.description: Adds 2 column data table. These can be used within given, when, then, and or but steps.
